Replace.Text: The container of blinding light has 52[ICON_Strength] combat power, 6[ICON_Movement] movement power, and 3 vision range. It does not require any strategic resources, and the maintenance fee is 0 [ICON_Gold] gold coins (as we all know, if the container is broken, throw it away, no maintenance is required) Production requires 90[ICON_Production] capacity (180[ICON_Production]->90[ICON_Production]). I planned to design a skill called "Seal", but I gave it a try.

instead of the arena. Only the bravest and strongest can survive the purgatory-like trials. and received a large number of gold coin rewards, which also led to the high maintenance costs of the Colosseum of Fools. Those who fail accidentally will be left with unwillingness and regret. Requires less [ICON_Production] capacity to build (150[ICON_Production]->100[ICON_Production]), As an entertainment area, it provides +3 [ICON_Amenities] amenity. Maintenance fee 8 [ICON_Gold] gold coins ( The basic amount is 2 [ICON_Gold] gold coins, and the three trials in the Colosseum correspond to 1, 2, and 3 [ICON_Gold] gold coins respectively). +3[ICON_GreatWork_Relic] relic slots. For this city, the production capacity of military units will be increased by 100% [ICON_Production]. If this city also has a military camp, then increase [ICON_Production] production capacity by 100%.

Instead of a library, it costs more productivity (90[ICON_Production]->120[ICON_Production]), The maintenance fee is 1 [ICON_Gold] gold coin. Teacher Monomon pursues change and has made great contributions to the development of science and education in Hallownest. The archives contain the manuscripts of the teacher Monomon, After completion, you will randomly receive one [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] encouragement from the Industrial Age and before. Provides +2[ICON_Science] technology, +2[ICON_Culture] culture, +2[ICON_GreatScientist] great scientist points, +1[ICON_GreatArtist] great writer point, +2[ICON_GreatWork_Writing] writing slots.

Instead of the ancient Roman theater, the construction productivity consumption is reduced (150[ICON_Production]->120[ICON_Production]), The maintenance fee is 1 [ICON_Gold] gold coin. The singer often composes songs and sings the most beautiful music in Hallownest, with lingering lingering sounds. Provides +2[ICON_Culture] culture, +3[ICON_GreatMusician] great musician points, +3[ICON_GreatWork_Music] music slots. After it is completed, the [ICON_CivicBoosted] encouragement of any era will be randomly triggered every time it enters a new era. [Note: This effect is based on unlocking the technology or municipal administration of the corresponding era for the first time, not the world era]

Replaces the Holy Land, the maintenance fee is 1 [ICON_Gold] gold coin, and the construction [ICON_Production] production capacity is greatly reduced. (54[ICON_Production]->18[ICON_Production]). The statue of the king stands in the fountain in the center of the square, attracting insects to worship. The bonus that Palace Square receives from adjacent areas is increased to 1. Provides +4 [ICON_Faith] faith. Provides +2 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet points.

Instead of commercial center. As an important transportation hub, the crossroad is full of insects and insects, and there is an endless stream of people coming and going. It is a major manifestation of the economic and cultural prosperity of Hallownest civilization. The area adjacent bonus is changed to +1. Provides [ICON_Culture] culture and [ICON_Production] production equal to the area's adjacent bonus. Providing domestic trade routes with more [ICON_Food] food, [ICON_Production] production capacity, and [ICON_Gold] coins, (0[ICON_Food]1[ICON_Production]0[ICON_Gold]->2[ICON_Food]2[ICON_Production]1[ICON_Gold]) Provide more [ICON_Gold] gold coins for international trade routes. (3[ICON_Gold]->6[ICON_Gold]) When construction is completed, [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route capacity +1, and a merchant unit will be given as a gift.

[Note: This area uses a holy land model, please carefully identify the area when playing the game] The characteristic area of ​​Hallownest civilization does not replace any area. It has no population requirements and can only be built in one city. Construction costs are greatly reduced, and when a city is captured, the area disappears. Provides a +3 adjacency bonus to most common areas and certain specialty areas. Gain +3[ICON_Science] technology, +3[ICON_Culture] culture, +3[ICON_Gold] gold coins, +3[ICON_Faith]faith, +3[ICON_Food]food, +3[ICON_Production] production capacity. Grants double the bonus to the Town Square for international and domestic trade. Looting this area will yield twice the amount of [ICON_Faith] as looting the Holy Land. When the construction is completed, you can obtain a Hollow Knight regardless of technological restrictions. Hollow Knights adjacent to this area gain +25 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.
Gain +25 [ICON_Strength] combat strength bonus from adjacent friendly Black Egg Temple Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] from adjacent Black Egg Temple Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] from adjacent Black Egg Temple Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] from adjacent Black Egg Temple Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] from adjacent Black Egg Temple Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] from adjacent Black Egg Temple Square
Ordinary Man's Blessing and Talisman Overload

Blessing of the Ordinary: There is a chance that your unit will leave [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] relics after death. Talisman Overload: Gain a wildcard slot, and after entering the Classical Era, gain an additional economic slot. After entering the Middle Ages, you will gain an additional economic slot. (At this point, you can use one slot to equip the Soul Eater (cross out)) [Note: This effect is based on unlocking the technology or municipal administration of the corresponding era for the first time, not the world era]

Radiation controls dreams and infects the minds of creatures. [Note: The increase in religious pressure has not been realized] The religious pressure released by all cities is +300%. After unlocking the stirrup technology, Radiant can be inspired by the method used to control the Hollow Knight, and all cities release an additional +100% religious pressure. Religious units gain +8[ICON_Religion] religious combat effectiveness and +5 missionary times, Apostles automatically receive the Arguer and Counselor upgrades. The loyalty of your city is locked at 100%, and the loyalty pressure released by each city to the surrounding areas is +6. If other cities lose all loyalty and are under the greatest loyalty pressure from Radiation, they will skip the free city phase. Add radiance directly.

The little knight has gone through hundreds of millions of trials and suffered countless hardships, and has completed the inability r045, radiant quick kill any radiant 3.0, Path of Pain in 1 minute and 40 seconds, any% speed run in 25 minutes, tas all Hallownest and other feats, and finally promoted to Void God, Become the God of Hallownest. Military units have +3[ICON_Strength] combat strength. Injured military units will not reduce combat strength. Military units gain experience value +400%, and the experience gained from fighting against units reaches the game's built-in upper limit (8). After military units fight, additional effects will be produced in the following order: 1. Gain an additional 7 experience points, 2. For every 7 points of experience, 1 point of life will be restored. 3. If the enemy is a unit, it will cause an additional 1 point of damage for every 7 experience points.
The iron will that is made into steel a hundred times
The Void God's powerful will +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power

The flexible Hallownest Brother can travel to any place in Hallownest with ease. All units have +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power. When passing through some landforms and rivers, Can ignore movement loss, but still affected by area control. Produce pioneer units +75% of [ICON_Production] capacity. After building or capturing a city, give a scout unit as a gift.
The effect of exploring Hallownest ignores the additional movement consumption caused by terrain.
Explore the Mothwing Cloak of Hallownest
Exploring Hallownest ignores the additional movement cost of crossing rivers.

The Pale King Worm has a unique talent for decoration, and it is not difficult to know that his architectural design ability is also extremely superb. Most general improvements in the city provide an additional +1 [ICON_Food] food. +4[ICON_Production] production capacity. Worm is good at arming every corner of the city with sharp saws. It allows citizens and troops to practice parkour in the saw bush. In this way, they can exercise their adaptability to the sawbush, and the friendly citizens are also willing to show the way to outsiders. The position of the saw is unpredictable, and enemies who are unfamiliar with the terrain will only suffer when they come to Worm's city—— The city gains the "Path of Pain" halo effect. Within 3 rings of the city, The maximum movement limit of the unit fighting with you is -2[ICON_Movement] (the effect can be superimposed, and the movement force returning to zero is equivalent to permanent imprisonment), The army gains +10 [ICON_Strength] combat effectiveness when fighting in its own cell or in cells adjacent to its own territory.
When fighting in your own territory or a cell adjacent to your own territory, +10[ICON_Strength] combat strength
There is no cry for suffering
Born from the hands of God and the void
You will seal the blinding light that spreads plague in people’s dreams
[COLOR_FLOAT_GOLD]You are completely surrendered and loyal to the Supreme Light[ENDCOLOR]
I like the civilization that entered the golden age with golden light, Slightly disgusted with the civilization living in ordinary times, Hate civilization living in the Dark Ages.
Like civilization bathed in golden light (golden age).
Slightly disgusted with civilizations that are not under the golden light (not the golden age).
I hate the insect civilization in the darkness (Dark Ages).
I! yes! spoke! Light! I! No! meeting! fear! fear! you!
I! territory! very! Can! Ru! All! what! like!
Sincerity! Sincere! invite! Ru! Come! I! Dream! territory!
have! friend! since! Far! square! Come! No! as well as! happy! Huh!
Light! mango! meeting! Will! you! swallow! bite!
I! tear! rotten! you! of! Mouth!
I! No! meeting! quilt! Legacy! forget!
Prefer civilizations that are not in the Golden Age, but don't hate civilizations that are in the Golden Age.
I like a civilization in which the golden halo disappears and continues to strive for self-improvement (not the golden age).
...(think you are going to start a war)
I like to explore civilizations with many maps, but hate exploring civilizations with few maps.
Like to explore more civilizations in the world.
Slightly dislike civilizations that don't understand the world well enough.
（｀へ´）(I’m unhappy that you didn’t explore the map too much)
(＾－＾) (I hope we can exchange capital information)
o((⊙﹏⊙))o (think you are going to start a war)

Likes to clear all landscapes and improve all tiles that can be improved. Prefers civilizations with a high percentage of improved cells. Hate civs that have a low percentage of improved cells, or build national parks.
Likes and dislikes depend on the amount of civilization improvement tiles, and dislike of national parks.
It is a pleasure to see the abundance of improvements within your borders.
Is this how you plan your land?
Hello, I am Worm, the Pale King, the ruler of Hallownest.
I hope you can come and visit my exquisitely decorated white palace.
It's great to see the prosperity and splendor of your city.
The friendship between Hallownest and your country will last forever.
After repeated consideration, I chose to refuse temporarily.
Can we deepen cooperation and create brilliance together?
Those who want to be soldiers and warriors, behead them with a sharp saw!
In the name of Hallownest, I declare war on you!
You should pay for your actions. [NEWLINE](condemn you)
Do you want to wage war against Hallownest?
Is it still possible to escape this fate after all?

The plague, infection, madness entangled with the insect corpses of Hallownest... the light shrieking from the eyes of the people of this declining kingdom. Where does this come from? Ordinary people like me will probably never understand.

Known as the God of the Gods by Godseekers, the Lord of Shadows in the game files, and often called the God of the Void by players. It is a very large void creature with many horns on its head, four arms, and eight glowing white eyes. There are also many twitching tendrils behind it.
A mysterious wanderer, using bone-breaking nails as weapons, sneaked into Hallownest beneath the surface and began his adventure.
A chainsaw should be added here as well.
The old king of Hallownest...he must really want to save his crumbling little world. The sacrifices he imposed on others... turned out to be in vain.
My king! You are such a hopeless bastard! (Unprovoked intrusion)
